s.text: Wolf did both, by turning the issue into an object lesson on women's professional success.
Who better to help a candidate extract weighty lessons from his personal history, to teach him to tell voters that their own successes depend on his own?
Wolf did both, by turning the issue into an object lesson on women's professional success.
Who better to help a candidate extract weighty lessons from his personal history, to teach him to tell voters that their own successes depend on his own?
She began her career by being a success--a Rhodes scholar with a splashy book--and has been tutoring others in how to succeed ever since.
She began her career by being a success--a Rhodes scholar with a splashy book--and has been tutoring others in how to succeed ever since.
"By telling my story and asking other women to tell theirs, I wanted to elucidate the emotional truths that emerge from a particular generation's erotic memory," she explains.

Because "history moves in response to narratives, dream images, heroes, heroines, and myths," women need to think of themselves as latter-day incarnations of "Diana, avenger of insult; Sheba, a responsible, politically influential sovereign; and Nike, the feminine spirit of victory."

In Fire With Fire , as Wolf settles into her persona as pep-talker, she tells women essentially the same thing she told Gore: Drop the victim-loser image, stop playing second fiddle, and use romantic archetypes to visualize the path to glory.
When the president's woman troubles started, Wolf hit the spin circuit.
When the president's woman troubles started, Wolf hit the spin circuit.

When the president's woman troubles started, Wolf hit the spin circuit.
No wonder she has spent so much time thinking about what color Al Gore's suits should be.
As Time reported earlier this week, Vice President Al Gore paid Wolf thousands of dollars a month for advice on presentation, from the tones of his speeches to the color tones of his wardrobe.
No wonder she has spent so much time thinking about what color Al Gore's suits should be.
